remarks: The elements of the fundamental group.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2010.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2015.)
statement:
elpi1.g $e |- G = ( J pi1 Y ) $.
elpi1.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
elpi1.1 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
elpi1.2 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. X ) $.
elpi1i.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( II Cn J ) ) $.
elpi1i.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 0 ) = Y ) $.
elpi1i.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 1 ) = Y ) $.
elpi1i $p |- ( ph -> [ F ] ( ~=ph ` J ) e. B ) $.
